intro: Onosma bornmuelleri, commonly known as the Kashmir wallflower, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Onosma bornmuelleri is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
